Variables

 $_print_urls = PRINT_URLS_DEFAULT

Detailed Description

Contains the functions to generate Printer-friendly pages.

This file is included by the core PF module, and includes all the functions necessary to generate a PF version of the original page in HTML format.

Function Documentation

_print_friendly_urls ( $  url = 0  ) 

Auxiliary function to store the Printer-friendly URLs list as static.

Parameters:
$url absolute URL to be inserted in the list
Returns:
list of URLs previously stored if $url is 0, or the current count otherwise.

_print_generate_book ( $  nid,
$  format = PRINT_HTML_FORMAT,
$  teaser = FALSE,
$  message = NULL 
)

Prepare a Printer-friendly-ready node body for book pages

Parameters:
$nid node ID of the node to be rendered into a printer-friendly page
$format format of the page being generated
$teaser if set to TRUE, outputs only the node's teaser
$message optional sender's message (used by the send e-mail module)
Returns:
filled array ready to be used in the template

$format format of the page being generated
$teaser if set to TRUE, outputs only the node's teaser
$message optional sender's message (used by the send e-mail module)

_print_rewrite_urls ( $  matches  ) 

Callback function for the preg_replace_callback for URL-capable patterns

Manipulate URLs to make them absolute in the URLs list, and to add a [n] footnote marker.

Parameters:
$matches array with the matched tag patterns, usually <a...>+text+
Returns:
tag with re-written URL and when appropriate the [n] index to the URL list

_print_robots_meta_generator (  ) 

Generates a robots meta tag to tell them what they may index

Returns:
string with the meta robots tag

_print_url_list_enabled ( $  node,
$  format = PRINT_HTML_FORMAT 
)

Check URL list settings for this node

Parameters:
node node object
$format format of the page being generated
Returns:
TRUE if URL list should be displayed, FALSE otherwise

_print_var_generator ( $  node,
$  message = NULL,
$  cid = NULL 
)

Post-processor that fills the array for the template with common details

Parameters:
$node generated node with a printer-friendly node body
$message optional sender's message (used by the send e-mail module)
$cid id of current comment being generated (NULL when not generating an individual comment)
Returns:
array with the fields to be used in the template

print_controller ( $  path,
$  cid = NULL,
$  format = PRINT_HTML_FORMAT,
$  teaser = FALSE,
$  message = NULL 
)

Select the print generator function based on the page type

Depending on the type of node, this functions chooses the appropriate generator function.

Parameters:
$path path of the original page
$cid comment ID of the individual comment to be rendered
$format format of the page being generated
$teaser if set to TRUE, outputs only the node's teaser
$message optional sender's message (used by the send e-mail module)
Returns:
array with the fields to be used in the template
